note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 3a).|17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings, keywords, and re-inking. Red teardrop textstops, some outlined in black. The text is vocalized. Illuminated title page (ʻunwān) in gold, blue, white and red (fol. 3a): consists of two panels outlined in blue with flecks at each corner and smaller ones on the upper line. Medallion on the upper left margin, with a floral motif in red, blue and gold, outlined in the same blue with a fleck radiating on the left side. The upper panel has the title written in white in stylized Kufic on a blue and gold ground with floral motifs in a three-lobe cartouche outlined in white, inscribed in a rectangular border in white. The spaces between the two white lines are filled in red, blue and gold. Gold and black outer border. Underneath is a panel with the name of the author in four lines written in gold in cloud cartouches left blank over a ground hatched in red with blue with arabesque in blue. Worm-eaten.|Illuminated title-page (unwān) of vol. 12 (fol. 2a) consists of one panel with a medallion on its upper left side, outlined in blue ink with flecks at each corner, in the middle of the left edge, and on the left sife of the medallion. The medallion, outlined in black, has a floral motif in gold and blue on a red ground with a gold border. The central panel is divided in two : the upper vertical rectangular panel is framed in gold and black and has the beginning of the title written in stylistic "Kufic" in gold on a blue ground with an arabesque in gold and red. The lower vertical rectangular panel has a gold and black border with the rest of the title and the statement of responsibility written in black naskh in cloud cartouches left blank and outlined in black over a ground hatched in red with arabesque in black ink with red and blue coloring.|Illuminated title-page (ʻunwān) of vol. 23 (fol. 3a) consists of a panel outlined in blue with flecks radiating from each corner and a group of four dots in the middle of each edge, except the upper one. The panel has a border of a chain motif in gold, blue, red and black. This border also divides the two elements of the panel, with an upper horizontal rectangle with the beginning of the title in gold outlined in black on a blue ground with a gold and red arabesque. The rest of the title and the statement of responsibility is written on the lower panel in seven lines in gold outlined in black in cloud cartouches outlined in black on a ground left undecorated except for a few leaves motifs in black ink. Medallion with a floral motif in gold, red and blue outlined in blue on the left margin. At each side of the title of the first Bāb (fol. 3b), gold, black and red teardrop outlined in blue with flecks on the vertical axis.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover of vol. 12 : "al-Thānī ʻashar min al-Bukhārī". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover of vol. 23 : "al-Juz al-thālith wa-al-ʻashrūn min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī".|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leiden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).

subject_as_recorded: Hadith--Texts--Early works to 1800
note: ff. 69. 215 x 151; 175 x 110 mm. 21 lin. 13th cen.|Fragment of a collection of traditions divided into kitābs (subdiv. into bābs) which follow the usual order of law-books; the peculiarity of this collection is that the last three ruwāh in every isnād are Muḥammads, cf. the passage quoted below.|The first complete book extant is kitāb al-wakālah which begins on fol. 1b as follows: ... کتاب الوکالة . باب فى وکالة الشرىك فى القسمة وغىرها . وقد اشرك النبى ... علىا فى هدىة ثم امره بقسمتها . حدثنا محمد قال حدثنا محمد قال حدثنا محمد قال حدثنا قصىبة ... عن على علىه السلام قال امرنى رسول الله ... ان اتصدق|The folio numbers (by a later hand) indicate that 59 leaves are missing at the beginning; there are lacunae after fol. 49 and 59; fol. 46b and 47a are blank; the ms. breaks off in litāb al-jihād wa-al-siyar which begins on fol. 64a.

subject_as_recorded: Hadith--Texts--Early works to 1800
note: ff. 263. 232 x 161; 150 x 96 mm. 19 lin. Rabīʻ II, 740, Shams al-Dīn ḥusayn ibn ḥājjī Shams.|Anonymous collection of traditions arranged in 12 kitābs; the title appears on bottom edge; the beginning of the first kilāb is missing, the second begins on fol. 14a: ... الکتاب الثانى فى القران والاذکار وفىه اربعة ابواب . الباب الاول فى القران وفىه اربعة فصول الفصل الاول فى مطلق فضله . عن ابى امامة ... قال سمعت رسول الله ... ىقول اقروا القران فانه ىأتى ىوم القىامة شفىعا|The headings of the remaining books are:|الثالث) فى العلم|الرابع) فى الرقاق|الخامس) فى الصحبة|السادس ) فى مکارم الاخلاق|السابع) فى رذائل الاخلاق|الثامن ) فى اللباس|التاسع ) فى الطب|العاشر ) فى تفسىر اقران|الحادى عشر ) فى الجهاد|الثانى عشر ) فى القىامة|ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, III, 587, no. 7066 (anon.).
